Touch Charts Examples

Release Notes for Touch Charts 2.0.0 beta

Release Notes: Februrary 24, 2012
Version Number: 2.0.0b

  • General Notes
    • This release provides full compatibility with Touch 2.0.0. Various examples have been revisited to apply the new MVC pattern to writing apps. New visualizations have been included such as TreeMap, Sunburst, Wordmap and Icicle visualizations. New examples have been written for these new visualizations. The animation package for graphics has gone through a re-design and implementation and faster algorithms for path manipulation have been added.
  • Fixes / Changes since last release
    • Full integration with Touch 2.0.0.
    • Added new TreeMap visualization for visualizing hierarchies in constrained space.
    • Added Sunburst visualization for radial layout of hierarchies.
    • Added Wordmap visualization, a space filling visualization for text elments.
    • Added Icicle visualization, a space filling visualization for hierarchies.
    • Added 2010 Census example (for tablets only).
    • Added TreeMap / Icicle example for 2012 budget proposal. Layouts can be changed dynamically.
    • Added simple sunburst example with random data.
    • Added Plot example to show how the new animation api can be used.
    • Added Wordmap example with back ease-in-out transitions.
    • Re-written World Data example to use the MVC pattern from Touch 2.
    • Re-written the Energy App example to use the MVC pattern from Touch 2.
    • Re-designed and implemented a new animation package. It's simpler and supports a dozen of new easing equations.
    • Re-designed path manipulation functions focusing on performance.
    • Re-designed legend sheets and items to be compatible with touch 2.0.0.
  • Known Issues
    • Dragging support for legend items used to rely on the Draggable class (that has been removed from Touch 2) and thus is not avaiable at the moment.
